Description: Tetradrachm of Syracuse. Obverse: Quadriga, Nike flying above, both to right. Reverse: Head of Arethusa, archaic, surrounded by four dolphins. 17.25gm axis: 9
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Town (Naukratis), Silversmith's Hoard (IGCH 1647), eastern part of town
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The piece is 347 in E. Boehringer's Die Muenzen von Syrakus (1929), but does not appear in Brett's catalogue of coins in the MFA. Not noted in Petrie's journal as among the coins he was offered.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (UA.008)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
